document_name: The implementation and control of HIV-AIDS in Ir Iran through public civil society and private partnerships.pdf

donor_name: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
outputs.output_descr:
1) At least 60% of 15-45 year-old population have universal knowledge about HIV transmission 
2) At least 85% of Injecting Drug Users (IDUs) adopt safe injecting practices and 42% of Injecting Drug Users (IDUs) adopt to use a condom in the last time they had sexual intercourse 
3) At least 55% of women at higher risk of HIV adopt to use a condom in the last time they had sexual intercourse
4) At least 60% of prisoners have universal knowledge about HIV transmission
5) Second line anti-retro-viral (ARVs) are available for 100% of People Living with HIV (PLHIV) infected with HIV resistant to first line ARVs 
6) 10 % of People Living with HIV (PLHIV) covered by positive clubs
7) Capacity building for NGOs to deliver effective HIV services 
8) Capacity building to assure successful implementation of National Strategic Plan (NSP)

donor_name: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
outputs.output_descr:
The first Objective is to "Pursue high quality DOTS expansion and enhancement." This is to expand DOTS services particularly through developing the microscopy laboratory network and improving monitoring & evaluation activities. Support for treatment supporters, and technical assistance for development of the drug management system are also included.
The second Objective is to "Address HIV/TB, MDR-TB and other challenges." This is to scale up specific care needed for patients suffering from MDR-TB and prisoners as appropriate. HIV/TB collaborative activities will be financed by national resources, and thus are not included in this proposal.
The third Objective is to "Empower people with TB, and communities." This is to support TB control by improving knowledge and attitude on TB as well as increasing the demand for TB care in the communities, particularly among the vulnerable populations.
The fourth Objective is to "Strengthen program management capacity." In order to effectively implement all activities related to the above Objectives. Program management capacity, particularly at the central level of NTP, needs strengthening.

donor_name: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
outputs.output_descr:
The five objectives are: 
Improvement of early case detection and prompt & effective anti-malarial treatment (all malaria cases will be treated according to the national malaria treatment guidelines on the basis of parasitological confirmation of diagnosis), 
Scaling up of Integrated Vector (mosquitoes) Management measures (at least 90% of target populations are protected by Long Lasting Insecticidal Nets or Indoor Residual Spraying), 
To enhance capability of forecasting, prevention, early detection and on time control of malaria epidemics (all malaria epidemics in target districts will be detected within one week of onset and contained within one month of detection), and 
To strengthen the capacity of health system to coordinate and implement malaria control interventions (the 3 South Eastern Provinces and the 20 target districts will have target malaria teams with trained staff and adequate resources for monitoring and evaluation and reporting malaria control activities in their area of intervention).

donor_name: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
outputs.output_descr: Intensified Malaria Control in High Burden Provinces towards Falciparum Elimination

donor_name: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
outputs.output_descr: The project is intended to support the Country Coordinating Mechanism (CCM) in its planning and administration, M&E, and advocacy activities

donor_name: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
outputs.output_descr:
1) At least 60% of 15-18 years at risk adolescents have universal knowledge about HIV transmission 
2) At least 60% of prisoners (including their family members) have universal  knowledge about HIV transmission
3) At least 80% of prisoners have reached by Voluntary Counseling and Testing (VCT) services
4) At least 85% of male Injecting Drug Users (IDUs) adopt safe injecting practices and 42% of Injecting Drug Users IDUs adopt to use a condom in the last time they had sexual intercourse 
5) At  least 55% HIV Vulnerable Women (HVW) adopt to use a condom in the last time they had sexual intercourse
6) At least 80% of excepted HIV positive pregnant women are covered by Anti-Retro-Viral (ARV) in selected districts
7) 100% of People Living With HIV (PLHIV) resistant to first line  Anti-Retro-Viral (ARVs) have access to second line  Anti-Retro-Viral (ARVs)
8) At least 10% of Known People Living With HIV (PLHIV) actively involved in positive club activities
9) Capacity building for NGOs to deliver effective HIV services 
10) Capacity building to assure successful  implementation of National Strategic Plan (NSP) 
11) Support and Capacity building for the programme
outputs.output_title: Prev. & Cont. of HIV R8 Phas 2

donor_name: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
outputs.output_descr: The project is intended to support the Country Coordinating Mechanism (CCM) in its planning and administration, M&E, and advocacy activities.

The Sub-Project is to be implemented in Chabahar, the southern district in Sistan and Baloochestan province, one of the major malaria foci of the country. In this urban area 99 malaria cases were reported in 2011. Although a significant reduction in malaria cases has been achieved over the recent years, risk of re-introduction of malaria transmission and occurring malaria outbreaks is high due to cross border population movement with Pakistan border and high level of vectorial capacity.  
Total number of 3,768 water reservoirs was identified as breeding places for mosquitoes in the locality.  Controlling malaria in urban setting is very difficult and costly by routine controlling measures, therefore finding an innovative and cost-effective method is a priority of the health system.  In keeping with the submitted R10 malaria proposal to the Global Fund (section 5.4.4), and the ongoing malaria project, it is of high priority to establish the best cost-effective vector control modality to eliminate malaria in urban setting, which is also aligned with National Strategic Plan for Malaria Elimination.  Given that Chabahar is the main industrial and trade zone in south east of the country and malaria has been considered as a barrier against development in this area, contributing to the efforts toward malaria elimination in this area is considered a high priority. 
Further to note is that the main objective of the Global Fund is elimination of falciparum malaria and Chabahar has a high potential for reintroduction of transmission of this type of malaria hence is a threat to the project success. This priority has been discussed and agreed upon between the officials of UNDP and Center for Disease Control (CDC), MoHME.  
The main activity of the Sub-Project is to cover the water reservoirs in Chabahar, Sistan and Baloochestan in two stages, pilot study (839 water reservoirs  that is the subject of this project) and intervention (2929 water reservoirs).  Total estimated budget for UNDP's contribution in the stage of pilot study, in which 839 water reservoirs is planned to be covered is 100,000 USD.  The Sub-Project is closely linked to the larger Global Fund project in the sense that the latter project presumes the sound implementation of the Sub-Project as a given.

project_descr: The prevention and control of HIV/AIDS, Malaria and Tuberculosis in I. R. Iran through public, civil society and private partnership - Global Funds for AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria (GFATM)
project_title: Prevention & control of HIV/AIDS, Malaria, TB in IR Iran
